# The 14 Best Waterproof (or Water-Resistant) Bluetooth Speakers for Summer
2020

Take it into the shower. Dunk it in the pool. Go white water rafting. These'll
hold up.

![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

By [Sarah Rense](/author/14093/sarah-rense/)

May 12, 2020

Courtesy

Speakers take a beating. We lug them across backyards and cross country. We
stuff them into the bottom of beach bags, where they mingle with sand,
sunscreen, and beer can condensation. And then there's the water—we clog them
with steam in the shower, put them too close to the lapping waves at the lake,
set them down near kids with water guns. We use them to blast summer hits
across a party full of tipsy people carrying Aperol spritzes who all want a
turn playing DJ (sadly, there might be less of that this summer). So owning a
waterproof—or at the very least, water-resistant—wireless speaker makes a
whole lot of sense.

Hold tight for some rather dry, owner's-manual speak: Bluetooth speakers come
with a rating system formatted like "IPXX" to indicate just how strong it is
against the elements. It's simple enough to translate. The first X will be a
number between zero and six that rates the speaker's ability to protect
against solids, like dust. The closer to six, the better. The second X will be
a number between zero and eight that rates the speaker's ability to protect
against liquids, like, you guessed it, water. The closer to eight, the better.  

Take the rating IP67: To you, that means the speaker has the best protection
against dust (six) and the near-best protection against water (seven).
Alternatively, the rating IPX4 means the speaker has no dust protection rating
and is only water resistant—a.k.a. you can't dunk it in the pool _._ All but
four of the speakers on this list have a waterproof rating of seven or higher,
which means you can submerge them in up to one meter of water for 30 minutes.
And since a lot of waterproof speakers are built to float, it likely won't
come to a half-hour dunking.

(If a speaker's rating has an X instead of a digit, that means there's no
official rating at all; you'll have to trust what the manufacturer says.)  

Now, onto the speakers themselves. These are the best waterproof (or water-
resistant) Bluetooth speakers to get you through the summer of 2020—whether
you're looking for pristine audio or something that's cheap and durable. Go
forth and share the music.

Best for the Shower

GO 2

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B07CZ45GMT/?linkCode=ogi)

JBL amazon.com

$49.99

[Buy](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B07CZ45GMT/?linkCode=ogi)

You don't need a $300 sound system with a subwoofer for your morning shower.
Or, if you do, you're showering differently than the rest of us. But this
little three-inch speaker from JBL will fill your bathroom with sound without
hogging counter or shelf space. Its speaker-phone capability means you can
field calls in the shower—but don't. And with an IPX7 rating, it's safe to
completely submerge, should it fall into the bath.

_Battery life: up to 5 hours_

Soundcore 2

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01MTB55WH?linkCode=ogi)

Anker amazon.com

$39.99

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01MTB55WH?linkCode=ogi)

Anker gives you a lot for not a lot of money. The speaker itself is waterproof
with an IPX7 rating, so you can cart it anywhere messy. It has an outstanding
battery life of up to 24 hours, which makes sense, considering Anker is best
known for its charging devices. But what really makes it stand out is its
BassUp technology. Unlike a lot of budget Bluetooth speakers, Anker doesn't
cheap out on the low end, producing rich, thumping bass.

_Battery life: up to 24 hours_

Best Boat Speaker

The Barnacle+

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=74968X1525077&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F135270&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.esquire.com%2Flifestyle%2Fg27555291%2Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-
speakers%2F%3Fpre%3Dlifestyle%252F%26prefix%3Dg%26id%3D27555291%26del%3D%26variantId%3D%26post%3D%252Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-speakers)

Speaqua rei.com

$49.93

[Buy](https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=74968X1525077&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F135270&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.esquire.com%2Flifestyle%2Fg27555291%2Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-
speakers%2F%3Fpre%3Dlifestyle%252F%26prefix%3Dg%26id%3D27555291%26del%3D%26variantId%3D%26post%3D%252Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-speakers)

This tiny speaker was built to be waterborne, whether via yacht or dinky
rowboat. It's able to float on the surface, but should it go overboard, an
IP68 rating means it can stay submerged for a good length of time. On board, a
suction cup grip will anchor it, and if Bluetooth is acting funky or you don't
want to risk bringing your phone out into the waves, it stores a thousand
songs internally that it'll shuffle through, no wireless connection required.
_  
_

_Battery life: up to 5 hours_

Best Sound Quality Under $75

SRS-XB12 Extra Bass

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P85CDHG?linkCode=ogi)

Sony amazon.com

$58.00

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P85CDHG?linkCode=ogi)

Sony's SRS-XB12 is small but mighty. Fully waterproof and dust-tight at a IP67
rating, it fits into the palm of your hand or into a car's cupholder. Throw
its detachable strap on, and it becomes a convenient wristlet or keychain. And
with punched-up bass, you'll hardly believe a thing so tiny could be producing
such rich, deep audio.

_Battery life: up to 16 hours_

Most Portable Speaker

CLIP 3

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q6ZWMLR?linkCode=ogi)

JBL amazon.com

$69.95

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q6ZWMLR?linkCode=ogi)

The CLIP 3 (rated IPX7) is like JBL's GO 2, only with better, louder playback.
And, as you can see, a carabiner, which makes a world of difference. You'll be
tempted to hook it onto anything you can—a shower rod, a golf cart, a
backpack, a tent strap, your dog's collar—and you absolutely should. It's a
workhorse of a waterproof Bluetooth speaker.

_Battery life: up to 10 hours_

StormBox

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0784ZQFHZ/?linkCode=ogi)

Tribit amazon.com

$57.99

[Buy](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0784ZQFHZ/?linkCode=ogi)

Tribit's StormBox covers all the bases for this level of speaker. Its design
mimics that of the exceptional UE speakers (more on them in a moment) but at
half the price. Its IPX7 rating means it's fully waterproof. It produces nice
(but not amazing) sound. And its battery life isn't lousy. All around, it's a
solid option for affordability.

_Battery life: up to 20 hours_

Best Party Speaker Under $75

GO

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B071H8MJ99?linkCode=ogi)

Aomais amazon.com

$69.99

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B071H8MJ99?linkCode=ogi)

The Aomais GO speaker is loud. Like, really loud. It can easily fill a riotous
party with decent quality sound, whether you're inside or out. And while it's
perhaps not the most stylish option on this list, that protective rubber and
tough-looking design make it virtually indestructible—an important quality
when drunk people are congregating. With an IPX7 rating, it allows for full
water submersion, too. You won't go broke buying it, and you'll have it for a
long, long time.

_Battery life: up to 30 hours_

Best Sound Quality Under $100

SoundLink Micro

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0748N1BZD?linkCode=ogi)

Bose amazon.com

$99.00

$79.00 (20% off)

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0748N1BZD?linkCode=ogi)

Bose is one of the best consumer-level speaker brands in terms of sound
quality. Unfortunately, you have to pay for that audio expertise. Case in
point: the SoundLike Micro (with an IPX7 rating), which is built to be carted
around but at a price point that'll make you consider taking out insurance on
it. The audio it produces is phenomenal, considering the diminutive size of
the thing. The trade-off is its pitiful battery life and, we'll say it again,
the cost.

_Battery life: up to 6 hours_

All-Around Best Speaker

Boom 3

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD3VXRZ?linkCode=ogi)

Ultimate Ears amazon.com

$149.99

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD3VXRZ?linkCode=ogi)

When in doubt, go with Ultimate Ears. UE makes an excellent waterproof
Bluetooth speaker, the Boom 3. With 360-degree sound built on a deep bass
foundation, it will impress anyone with a keen ear for audio. It is rated IP67
for dust and water protection, but you'd hardly know it from its nice-looking
fabric cover. Though the one-touch button makes selecting music simple, it
comes with an app, too. The Boom 3 is an indisputable winner, hitting the
sweet spot of really good design and fair pricing.

_Battery life: up to 15 hours_

Most Stylish Speaker

Kilburn II

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B07H7CZ6BZ/?linkCode=ogi)

Marshall amazon.com

$299.99

$199.99 (33% off)

[Buy](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B07H7CZ6BZ/?linkCode=ogi)

Marshall makes speakers that look so damn cool. The Kilburn II is one of
them—and even though it has an IPX2 rating, meaning it is resistant to only a
few splashes of water, it's worth considering for the style alone. It is a
powerful box, with nobs to control volume, bass, and treble for pristine audio
control. You won't find that on most Bluetooth speakers. It's about the size
of a lunch box, and that strap makes for easy carrying; but go for [the
Stockwell II model](https://www.amazon.com/Marshall-Stockwell-Portable-
Bluetooth-Speaker/dp/B07Q12WDP2) for something smaller and cheaper.

_Battery life: 20+ hours_

SoundLink Revolve+

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XCW4VFS?linkCode=ogi)

Bose amazon.com

$299.00

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XCW4VFS?linkCode=ogi)

Another excellent but pricey Bose speaker. With the SoundLink Revolve+, you'll
get all-encompassing sound, voice prompts, and the Bose Connect app. The
speaker can also go into Stereo or Party mode. However, with an IPX4 rating,
it's only water resistant.

_Battery life: up to 16 hours_

Best Adventure Speaker

DemerBox DB2

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B076FBZ53W/?linkCode=ogi)

DemerBox amazon.com

$332.67

[Buy](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B076FBZ53W/?linkCode=ogi)

The DemerBox Speaker is rugged. Drop the thing off a cliff, and it'll probably
still work. The Bluetooth range is great (up to 100 feet) and the battery life
is superb. It isn't rated, but it says it is "100-percent waterproof," and it
even opens up like a toolbox to give you internal storage that stays dry.
There's also an internal USB charger to keep your phone charged. This is a
Bluetooth speaker built for adventure.  

_Battery life: up to 40 hours_

Best Indoor/Outdoor Speaker

Move

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

waterproof-bluetooth-speakers)

Sonos sonos.com

$399.00

[Buy](https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=74968X1525077&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sonos.com%2Fen-
us%2Fshop%2Fmove.html%3Fgclsrc%3Daw.ds%26%26utm_campaign%3DGGL_US_EN_SONOS_B_MOVE_EXACT_360i%26utm_medium%3Dcpc%26utm_source%3Dgoogle%26utm_content%3DGGL_US_EN_SONOS_B_MOVE_EXACT_360i%26utm_term%3Dsonos%2520move%26gclid%3DCjwKCAjw5cL2BRASEiwAENqAPhKBRmoy_qSWXEGDNkiJ4WxEvgWmc1Cw-

xMnB8N8-WQbrcQRoCIDsQAvD_BwE%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.esquire.com%2Flifestyle%2Fg27555291%2Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-
speakers%2F%3Fpre%3Dlifestyle%252F%26prefix%3Dg%26id%3D27555291%26del%3D%26variantId%3D%26post%3D%252Fbest-
waterproof-bluetooth-speakers)

Sonos' Move speaker is big and beautifully designed. Everything about it is
done correctly: the smart assistant integration, the audio depth, the
controls. And though you can't see it here, it has a handle carved into the
back so you can grab and, see what they did here, _move_. Use it inside, in
every room. Use it outside, wherever you wander. It's sturdily built and has a
dust-and-waterproof rating of IP56, so splashes of water and clods of dirt
won't do harm.  

_Battery life: up to 10 hours_

Boombox

[
![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)
](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0759GC766?linkCode=ogi)

JBL amazon.com

$499.95

[Buy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0759GC766?linkCode=ogi)

JBL made a waterproof Bluetooth speaker that is as loud and bulky as an old-
school boombox. Hence its name: Boombox. The sound coming out of this speaker
is immense, with enough bass to make the pool water ripple. Its ability to
connect to two devices is ideal for parties, tailgates, and anywhere else
people are fighting over the playlist. And it has IPX7 waterproofing. If you
need loud, lasting power, the Boombox is your best option.

_Battery life: up to 24 hours_
